alert.note: Alert for Knox; Marion; Morrow (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 1:02AM EST until March 05 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following counties, Ashland, Crawford, Knox, Marion, Morrow and Richland. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring with numerous roads closed. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Marion, Ashland, Mount Vernon, Bucyrus, Mount Gilead, Galion, Shelby, Ontario, Lexington, Crestline, Loudonville, Fredericktown, New London, Gambier, Cardington, Bellville, Plymouth, Centerburg and Prospect. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
